prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. Evaluate $\lfloor-2.54\rfloor+\lceil25.4\rceil$.
solution: The greatest integer less than $-2.54$ is $-3$; the smallest integer greater than $25.4$ is $26$. So $\lfloor -2.54 \rfloor + \lceil 25.4 \rceil = -3+26=\boxed{23}$.
gpt_response: To solve this problem, we first round -2.54 down to the nearest whole number. That makes it -3. Then we round 25.4 up to the nearest whole number. That makes it 26. Finally, we add -3 and 26 together to get 23. So the answer is 23!
solution_prompt: Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to 23?: To solve this problem, we first round -2.54 down to the nearest whole number. That makes it -3. Then we round 25.4 up to the nearest whole number. That makes it 26. Finally, we add -3 and 26 together to get 23. So the answer is 23!
